headline: Best Spanish Rice
description: This Spanish rice recipe is easy to make with white rice, chicken broth, and tomato picante sauce for the perfect accompaniment to Mexican dishes.

video.description: See a quick-and-easy recipe for the best Spanish rice.
video.name: Best Spanish Rice

name: Best Spanish Rice

recipeInstructions.text: Heat oil in a large, heavy skillet over medium heat. Add onion; cook and stir until tender, about 5 minutes.
Add rice; cook and stir until rice begins to turn golden brown. Stir in chicken broth and picante sauce. Reduce heat, cover, and simmer until liquid has been absorbed, about 15 to 20 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Perfect the way it is.
Yes because I used a chunky salsa I did need to adjust (+)the amount of water by a 1/4 cup Tasted awesome

This was the perfect foundation for the Spanish rice I wanted to make as an accompaniment to my son's 24th birthday "Taco Bar" family dinner. I used 1/2 large onion chopped, 1/2 c finely chopped red pepper and our usual Basmati rice on hand. For the broth I used "Better than Bouillon" chicken broth; and rather than the picante sauce, I used 1 c of our salsa on hand which happened to be medium Tostitos salsa, that I pureed. It all came together so nicely. I garnished it with fresh cilantro and served with extra optional cilantro. Yum! My son and 2 daughters enjoyed it and hubs mentioned at least 3 times, just how good it was!

I've made this recipe several times to great acclaim--even by the kids. I've made it enough times that I feel like trying it in different ways (such as with green salsa instead of the recommended tasty Pace Picante sauce). I also like adding some frozen corn a few minutes before the end of cooking just to add another flavor element. But just as it is, this recipe is a hit and not to be missed.
Love it and easier than the recipe I have!!
Mild picante, just right amount of heat. Added a little bacon. Perfect!
Perfect as written. Very easy to modify based on your preferences. We use a mild salsa and more onion.

This is really tasty and so very simple. I do have a couple of notes, though. First, pay attention to the amount of liquid you're using. I tend to use chunky salsa instead of picante sauce - it's just what I usually have on hand. But if you do that, you'll need to up the total amount of liquid used. Generally, you want a 2-1 water-to-rice ratio, and chunky salsa is not 100% water, so I use about 1.5 cups of chunky salsa and 2.5 cups of chicken broth. I've also added some crumbled bacon (or jarred bacon bits) while it cooks and sprinkle on some shredded cheese once it's done, just to dress it all up a bit. Maybe top with some sliced green onion as well?

The best Spanish rice. I doubled the recipe. I added bell peppers, Anaheim peppers, and more onion. Because I am at 9,600 feet elevation, I have to use ALOT more liquid when making rice. I also added 1 tsp of taco seasoning. I took this rice to a pot luck and had maybe ¼ cup left over. It was a hit. Definitely a keeper!
Every time I make this, it is a favorite. I rarely add extra onion as the salsa has it and my hubby is not an onion fan. Super easy, extremely delicious!
Did a just a can of stock and little extra salsa. Good base recipe though!!
This turned out really good. Better than every other spanish rice recipe I have tried. And there have been plenty. I blended the salsa so there were no chunks. My whole family ate all if it

Really good! It was a tiny bit undercooked, so next time I will add a little more chicken broth. My son doesn't like the salsa chunks, so I put it in my tiny blender. I have made it with minced onions and without and honestly, there is no difference. So, from now on, I will omit the onions because it's one less step and clean-up! After it's finished cooking, I top it with a layer of pepperjack cheese and Mexican blend cheese, cover the top and let the cheeses melt. My guys love it! Super easy, thanks for the recipe!

I made this today for a Mexican themed birthday party. I didn't think it had much taste, and I did add chili powder to it. Really kind of bland. I also doubled the recipe for 7 people and had more than half of it leftover.
Really enjoyed this, and very easy to make. Anyone who thought it was bland may not have been using the most flavorful salsa. So if you get a strong salsa that you like, you should be good to go.
Absolutely loved it !! So easy and so delicious, definitely the best recipe I’ve come across.

Every other recipe I've tried for Spanish rice turned in to a mushy bland mess. This turned out perfectly, rivaling my favorite Mexican restaurant's rice. No need to adjust a bit of anything with this recipe. Delicious!
A good and easy spanish rice I just suggest using non-stick pan, I used cast iron and it stuck a bit.
Used garlic oil

So easy and so good! I love how this recipe can be tailored to accommodate just about any preference! The only thing I added was some diced green and red pepper. My husband doesn't like anything too spicy and was a little leery of trying it, but he loved it! Thanks so much for sharing!
I made it with Uncle Ben's parboiled brown rice and it was good. Thanks for the recipe.
Easy and flavourful! Served it with Mexican turkey meatloaf.
I made this with tacos and refried beans, my husband absolutely loves this recipe. He said it was much better than what you get at Mexican restaurants.

I added some cilantro and mixed Rotel with the salsa I had to make it chunky and give it a little kick. I'm not sure I let my rice brown long enough though.....when the rice was done, I drizzled enchilada sauce on top with a little shredded cheese and fresh cilantro.
Just as good as the restaurants! My family loved this recipe!
Followed directions but added 2-3 (depending on size of peppers) diced serrano peppers and tsp of turmeric for eye appeal.
Made it. It was great 👍 👌 T.Y
If you want rice that isn’t soupy try and use 1/4 cup less chicken broth. Came out awesome. Add salt to taste, as well as some chopped cilantro, it makes a big difference!

I have made this several time. It tastes great and is easy to make. I never buy the box mixes at the grocery store any more. I follow the recipe exactly. I especially like the texture. The rice feels smooth, not at all sticky. The overall texture of the dish is semi-moist. Because I am only cooking for two, there are always left overs. They warm up beautifully in the microwave.
Great

I used long grain brown rice which can be tricky to cook without getting "sticky". 1 cup LG brown rice and 2 and 1/4 cups chicken stock were only changes. The brown rice required 45 minutes of simmer time but came out so perfect. Excellent recipe. I will use frequently with brown rice.
Was good substituted butter for the oil
Family loved it.
Almost perfect! I guess it's just a matter of perspective, but this a A LOT closer to what you find in the restaurants than what I had been making!

I made my own Spanish rice as an experiment years ago and this is almost exactly what I did! I didn't add the extra onions, but I did heat up a little butter and olive oil to toss the rice with before adding to the chicken broth/salsa water. It turned out absolutely perfect as this one is. The extra onion does give it a little more flavor. As someone else stated the liquid ratio may be light depending on (my guess) your salsa choice. I have to use an extra 1/4 to 1/3 cup broth and watch the last 5-10 minutes that it doesn't use it up before it's done.
I added small clove of garlic & diced tomatoes and green chilies.
Very tasty and easy

Everyone loved this recipe. I did simmer for 15 minutes after it came to a boil and then let it sit for 15 minutes before serving and the rice was perfectly cooked. Make sure to use the full amount of liquid that it calls for. Next time I will use a different salsa, but that was not the fault of the recipe. This will be my go to from now on. Thank you for sharing!
Used extra onion, 2.5 cups of broth, and added green onion. Delicious and the kids ate it!
I've made this twice now, and it tasty, quick and easy. Both times I've had to add more chicken broth so the rice would cook before scorching - but I will be making it again and again.
Love this recipe. I went with just a bit less oil, but other than that, no changes needed!

Love how simple it is to make the rice and the flavor it has! I used medium think n chunky H‑E‑B salsa which gave a really nice kick the consistency of the rice is perfect also. I’ve struggled making rice before and every time it comes out mushy. Love this recipe…the leftovers are really great to use to make fried rice 😁
This was absolutely AMAZING!! I did add 1 tablespoon of taco seasoning to it and it gave it the perfect kick. My family loved this and I will be making this again !!
This was so easy and is delicious! I used green onions and butter, other than that I followed the recipe. So good!
I add some minced garlic in with the onion and plenty of seasonings. Usually some combination of cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, cayenne, paprika, salt, and pepper.
I made no changes and it was really flavorful. It went not my enchiladas.
This was amazing. My kids ages 4-19 even loved it. I added a little yellow and red bell peppers too. I also used Mateo gourmet salsa which is not chunky. Best EVER!!
Easy and tasty.

Anyone saying this is sticky rice is not following the recipe. You cannot skip the step of sautéing and browning the rice. I’ve made this so many times and have never had it come out sticky. I do recommend chicken stock, if you want more flavor just had some extra spices in the beginning. to me it’s a perfect quick spanish rice. Anyone that says otherwise is comparing it to made from scratch or didn’t follow the recipe. 

Highly recommend for a quick easy tasty side dish!
This is my go to recipe for Spanish rice!!!! I've made it several times and everyone loves it!!! I serve it with every mexican dish I cook!!! 5 stars for sure!!
Family love it!!

Super easy to make, turns out great every time! I double the recipe to have leftovers. I have used the PACE picante Medium as well as the Pace Medium Salsa, the Salsa tends to have a little more heat than the Picante. Great recipe.

Great recipe! I've made this so often in the past two years. It's the perfect side dish for so many entrees. I make it ahead to the browned rice stage, then reheat it and finish cooking the rice in time for serving.
Great recipe and so easy!
Delicious! Thank you for sharing!

Super easy and tasty. Coming from me that is something because I cannot cook rice. To those worried about it being bland or lacking flavor, pay attention to the salsa. I’ve made this several times with different salsa and a few times have been disappointed. Since salsa is your only ingredient with any flavor it plays a HUGE part in the outcome.

It’s a really tasty and easy recipe. I’ve made it a few times and I now bulk it up to make a main dish out of it.
I sauté meat with the onion, often a mix of chicken and shrimps, or chicken and sausage, anything you have. It’s also great with leftover rotisserie chicken or pork loin. I add more veggies like peppers, mushroom, spinach, etc. It’s really easy to add ingredient and very forgiving.
This is my go to Spanish rice recipe. I always brown the rice and use Pace picante sauce (1 1/2 cups). Easy to make and delicious every time!
This was great! Very tasty, even my kiddos love it! I used frozen onions for an easier prep.
Great recipe! Flavorful!
Great recipe. I did add jalapeno and habanero peppers to spice it up. I also had to use 32 ounces of chicken broth. This is a keeper.
really good thanks!
An easy recipe for really flavourful rice. I didn’t have chicken broth in the house so I used the beef broth I had. Great texture for the rice.
I Did not love this. Neither did my kids or my husband. It was too wet and had too much tomato. The liquid definitely needed to be cut back.
Love it!!!!
I went to make this and realized my jar of salsa had expired, so I improvised a bit using a can of tomato sauce, a tomato, and a packet of taco seasoning. Turned out great!!
Turned out perfectly!

I have made this recipe countless times; my tip for AMAZING rice is to puree the salsa and onion then add the at same time as the chicken stock. Kids who don't like chunks of vegetables will thank you
Much too spicy even though I used a mild salsa. Next time I will do 50/50 mild salsa and tomato sauce.
Was looking for a simple Spanish rice dish for a family get together. Wow this one was easy and really good. Definitely a keeper.
I love this recipe. When I make it as a main dish, I add a can of corn, a can of black beans and a can of diced tomatoes. Occasionally, I add in meat.
Good, added tomato paste instead of salsa, only about 3 tablespoons
I followed the recipe exactly—this rice recipe is SO good and so easy!
It was the perfect side dish. Very tasty just like in the restaurants. I followed the recipe and advice from other comments and it turned out perfectly. I will definitely make this again. Thanks
Quick and easy and delicious.

. This came out delicious. Instead of salsa, I used tomato sauce. I added Jalapeno, garlic powder and onion powder. I also had to let it cook for twice as this recipe says (40 minutes) because I live at 6000 ft elevation.

I use this recipe with a few slight changes. I put the chopped onions in the bottom of my rice cooker and use the knife to keep the cook function going until the onion becomes fragrant, or a little extra. then throw everything in the rice cooker. set to cook and I'm done.
This was the best spanish rice and the easiest recipe to follow. My family loved it.
It was okay but make sure you put in three cups of liquid or you'll have crunchy rice. Otherwise it was good.
Too much oil. Would probably use butter for the flavor profile
Great recipe! This will be a go-to in my house.
This rice has excellent flavor and was quick and easy to prepare. Thanks!

I have made this several times, and it always gets good reviews from the fam. I use Pace Hot, because we always have it on hand. I have never had a problem with the rice being hard but I usually use the rice to liquid ratio on the bag, depending on what type of rice I have on hand. Long grain seems to work best. I also cook the rice till it's translucent. I have other recipes that use this method and I like the added flavor it adds. And I have started adding the cumin! What an easy and good recipe!

This was awesome! I made a double batch because I was making it for a meal for our local Family Promise families and wanted to have some for us, too. The only change I made was to use Kroger's fire roasted salsa style diced tomatoes instead of chunky salsa. It was yummmmmmmm!

This came out really good! I recommend adding copped bell peppers. When the timer goes off at 20 mins, leave the rice on the heat, top with shredded cheese, and leave it there for an addition minute or less, just until cheese it melted. :)

I followed exactly as written save for adding some minced garlic.
I brought to a boil and then turned low to simmer, never taking the lid off, then removed after 20 minutes and let rest with the lid on for 5 more.
It still came out crunchy but tastes good. Have added more chicken broth and am going to cook a little longer.
I think I had the heat too high so my rice didn't fully cook. Added some more broth and it was fine. With enough salt, this is delicious.
This was easy make, and certainly good. I agree this bests our local restaurant's rice! In reviewing other comments I added more broth and minced garlic. That's just OUR families , loves garlic.
Wouldn’t change a thing!

Don’t let the simple ingredients fool you. I have tried about five different other recipes for Spanish rice. This one was spot on the closest to what I find in Mexican restaurants. I have made it three times. The first time it was great. The second time I didn’t have any bottled salsa so I used a fresh salsa.. The fresh salsa did not have enough tomato (sauce) backbone. So definitely use the traditional bottled salsa. The third time I added some cumin and although it did taste great it did not taste like restaurant style rice. Only suggestions I would have is since chicken broth usually comes in less than a 2 cup can, I used one can and upped the salsa to almost 2 cups. If you want it spicy or use hot salsa, a little less medium salsa, and my family actually prefers mild. For the traditional taste of Mexican restaurants I recommend using mild. One other note, make sure the rice is lightly browned before adding wet ingredients. Otherwise your rice will become sticky.

I thought this was a nice and easy, straightforward recipe. I recommend trying it as written the first time and then adapting to your own taste. Next time I will add more seasoning and extra salsa but some people may want less.
The flavor is nice. I've made this 3 times now. It takes much longer to cook and needs more liquid than called for in the recipe.
I made this recipient in my rice cooker. Turned out great!
I used cauliflower rice, had amazing flavor and easy on the waistline!!
it is good and easy to make .

Perfect as written! For what it’s worth we use avocado oil (recipe just says “oil”) and simply nature thick and chunky medium salsa for our salsa. We’ve made it multiple times with great results. We toss in the liquids once there are a few grains starting to turn brown.

Easy and quick dinner idea. I originally was making the rice for tacos, but added some browned chicken cubes and it was delicious. I used brown rice because that is what I had and cooked for 45 min. Thank you!
Not bad. Used homemade stewed tomatoes ad less salsa.
It was an instant hit with my family. So easy to make, love it!
